name: dollish
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
like a doll (= a child's toy in the shape of a small person or baby), especially in a way that does not seem natural: The actress moved about the stage in a dollish way. The girls all had the same stiff, dollish appearance. Related word
doll
More examplesFewer examplesShe gave them a dollish smile and left the table. She was a tiny, dollish-looking girl with blue eyes and rosy cheeks.I was tired of looking at her little dollish face.A dollish young man entered the room and looked about.Her hair was tied up with a curl dangling to the side of her dollish face.
